clinical_study.brief_title: The Use of Palliative Non Invasive Ventilation in Acute Respiratory Failure. OVNI Study.
clinical_study.official_title: Qualitative Outcomes After Palliative Noninvasive Mechanical Ventilation : OVNI Study

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is:
- to estimate the frequency of the use of non invasive ventilation
- to estimate the frequency of the use of palliative non invasive ventilation
- to evaluate the impact of non invasive ventilation
- to propose some recommendations

detailed_description.textblock:
The purpose of this study is:
- to estimate the frequency of the use of non invasive ventilation
- to estimate the frequency of the use of palliative non invasive ventilation
- to evaluate the impact
- to propose some recommendations

primary_outcome.measure: Quality of life of patients receiving palliative noninvasive mechanical ventilation
primary_outcome.description: Quality of life, assessed by short-form (SF)-36 health survey at day 90 after ICU discharge (average expected duration=7 days)

secondary_outcome.description: Anxiety and depression at day 90 after ICU discharge (expected average duration=7 days), evaluated by Hospital Anxiety Depression Scale

secondary_outcome.time_frame: patients will be followed during an average time of 14 days (mean hospitalization time) and until day 90 after ICU discharge
secondary_outcome.description: Survival status (0=alive, 1=deceased)at ICU discharge (average expected duration=7 days)and hospital discharge (average expected duration=14 days), day 90 after ICU discharge, day 180 after ICU discharge and 1 year after ICU discharge

secondary_outcome.measure: Post traumatic stress disorder, evaluated by Impact of Event Scale(IES) questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: PTSD evaluated by the Impact of Event Scale at day 90 after ICU discharge (average expected duration=7 days)

study_pop.textblock: Patients with non invasive ventilation in ICU

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Acute respiratory failure
- hospitalization in ICU
- age >= 18 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who have already participated to OVNI
